definition: to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve

sentences.english: Thanks to their father's rescue, they could return home safe.
sentences.chinese: 幸获父亲援救，他们才得以安然回家。

sentences.english: Vice Premier Zhang Dejiang has gone to the Zhangjialing mine to supervise the rescue operation.
sentences.chinese: 副总理张德江已经奔赴张家岭煤矿进行援救监督工作。

sentences.english: The wounded driver looked round for help,but no one was by.
sentences.chinese: 受伤的司机四下张望寻求援救，但附近无一人。

sentences.english: Help him to rescue his offspring and lead them back to safety.
sentences.chinese: 帮助他援救他的子孙和领引他们回到安全。

sentences.english: We will help Iraq train its security forces and develop its economy.
sentences.chinese: 我们将援救伊拉克教练安全盘队和起色经济。

sentences.english: The troops came to the relief of the besieged garrison.
sentences.chinese: 军队来援救被围的守备军。

sentences.english: More troops were sent to relieve the besieged city.
sentences.chinese: 为了援救这座被围的城市派去了更多的部队。

sentences.english: Rescue workers removed the fishing line.
sentences.chinese: 援救人员把他救了下来，去掉了钓鱼线。

sentences.english: The rescuers worked like hell to free the man from the wrecked car.
sentences.chinese: 援救者拼命地干想把那人从撞坏的汽车中解救出来。

sentences.english: Sergi Many organizations are helping out.
sentences.chinese: 许多组织正在援救他们。

sentences.english: Moreover, their size made them too big to be bailed out by the Icelandic government.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他们的规模过大，致使冰岛政府无力援救他们。

sentences.english: They were succoured from the fire by the rescue helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 他们被援救的直升机从大火中解救了出来。

sentences.english: That success led to a second government-orchestrated rescue that year.
sentences.chinese: 那一次的成功引出了当年第二次的政府援救。

sentences.english: The specific measures for searching and rescuing civil aircraft shall be formulated by the State Council.
sentences.chinese: 搜寻援救民用航空器的具体办法，由国务院规定。

sentences.english: A tough-love bail-out would still need someone with deep pockets to provide the cash.
sentences.chinese: 强硬的援救仍然需要财务情况较好的人来提供。

sentences.english: But Aunt Josephine came to his rescue.
sentences.chinese: 但约瑟芬姨母来援救他了。

definition: in imminent peril (idiom)/on the brink of crisis
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
